chapter.title: The menubar
chapter.para: Within the mainbar you may do basic tasks like open/close files or show this help. In this section we cover briefly the the different entries.

sect1.title: File
sect1.para: The file menu lets you do maintenance related to files or quit application.

listitem.para: Save as - save your current work as a different filename.
Export - export to PCM audio file.

sect2.title: Export to PCM audio file
sect2.para: This shows you the export dialog. You may select filename to export to and duration of the exported track. BPM adjustment is take from the navigation. Basically &ags; exports what you hear of the speakers.
With the export toggle button you can start exporting to PCM audio file or stop it at an arbitrary time.

sect1.title: Edit
sect1.para: The edit menu lets you add/remove audio machines or open preferences dialog.

listitem.para: Panel - acts as your default sink.
Mixer - enables you to bundle your different output engines.
Drum - is used to do pattern editing using PCM audio files.
Matrix - is used to pattern editing, intended to be linked against Synth.
FFPlayer - may be used to open Soundfont2 audio file container format.

sect2.title: Preferences dialog
sect2.para: Within preferences dialog you may choose between different topics. For each one one tab.

sect3.title: Generic
sect3.para: The autosave thread option enables auto-saving to $HOME/.gsequencer directory.

sect3.title: Audio
sect3.para: Sound card is your physical devices to do playback.
Audio channels specifies the audio channels to allocate for output device.
Samplerate affects the entire project. Your audio files have to be at very same rate further your device has to support the given rate.
Buffer size is used for all audio buffers. Your soundcard has to support the passed buffer size.

sect3.title: Performance
sect3.para: Auto-sense on stream is required for certain LADSPA plugins but may cause additional performance losses.
